solution_line_template: She then bought lunch for twice the value of the novel, so lunch cost her ${novel_cost} x {lunch_multiplier} = $<<{novel_cost}*{lunch_multiplier}={lunch_cost}>>{lunch_cost}.
To find out how much money she has left from her gift she must know the total amount she spent ${novel_cost} + ${lunch_cost} = $<<{novel_cost}+{lunch_cost}={total_spent}>>{total_spent}.
Her gift was ${initial_gift}, so she was left with ${initial_gift} - ${total_spent} = $<<{initial_gift}-{total_spent}={money_left}>>{money_left}.
